message.content: This question requires some understanding of the concept of matter and its properties. When an object is broken down, its shape and mass are altered. The object may be fragmented or divided into smaller pieces, but its mass remains the same. Option (A) is incorrect because breaking down an object does not necessarily turn it into water. Option (B) is a statement of fact but does not provide a specific answer to the question. Option (D) is incorrect because breaking down an object does change its shape and possibly its mass, depending on the specific circumstances.

Option (B) is an incomplete statement and does not accurately describe what happens to an object when it is broken down. Option (D) is incorrect because the shape and mass of an object are changed when it is broken down.
